CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: By addition of 1% 1,8-diiodooctane ( DIO ) into o-DCB used for spin - coating , the PCEs of the solar cells based on PzNDTDTBT or PzNDTDTBO were improved to 3.22 and 4.63% , respectively , mostly through an increase in the FF.

Let's think step by step.

1. o-DCB: This is an organic solvent commonly used as a host material in organic solar cells during the spin-coating process. It is identified as an "Organic Solvent" or "Host Material" entity.
2. 1,8-diiodooctane (DIO): This is a material that, when added to o-DCB, improves the performance of solar cells. It is identified as an "Additive" or "Material Additive" entity.
3. PzNDTDTBT: This is a specific type of organic semiconductor material used in the solar cells. It is identified as a "Semiconductor Material" or "Organic Semiconductor" entity.
4. PzNDTDTBO: This is another type of organic semiconductor material used in the solar cells. It is identified as a "Semiconductor Material" or "Organic Semiconductor" entity.
5. PCEs: This stands for "Power Conversion Efficiency," which is a measure of the efficiency of the solar cells. It is identified as a "Performance Metric" entity.
6. FF: This stands for "Fill Factor," which is another performance metric for solar cells. It is identified as a "Performance Metric" entity.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

1. o-DCB: organic solvent used as a host material
2. 1,8-diiodooctane (DIO): material additive
3. PzNDTDTBT: organic semiconductor material
4. PzNDTDTBO: organic semiconductor material

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| o-DCB (organic solvent used as a host material) |
| 1,8-diiodooctane (DIO) (material additive) |
| PzNDTDTBT (organic semiconductor material) |
| PzNDTDTBO (organic semiconductor material) |

Paragraph: By addition of 1% 1,8-diiodooctane ( DIO ) into o-DCB used for spin - coating , the PCEs of the solar cells based on PzNDTDTBT or PzNDTDTBO were improved to 3.22 and 4.63% , respectively , mostly through an increase in the FF.

Let's think step by step.

2. o-DCB (used for spin-coating)
3. PCEs (Photoconversion Efficiencies)
4. PzNDTDTBT
5. PzNDTDTBO
6. FF (Fill Factor)

2. FF (Fill Factor)

PV.content:
Please identify the "Property Value" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: By addition of 1% 1,8-diiodooctane ( DIO ) into o-DCB used for spin - coating , the PCEs of the solar cells based on PzNDTDTBT or PzNDTDTBO were improved to 3.22 and 4.63% , respectively , mostly through an increase in the FF.

Let's think step by step.

1. 1%: Percentage of 1,8-diiodooctane (DIO) added to o-DCB.
2. 1,8-diiodooctane (DIO): Property Value - Chemical compound.
3. o-DCB: Property Value - Chemical compound.
4. PCEs: Property Value - Power Conversion Efficiency.
5. 3.22%: Property Value - Power Conversion Efficiency for PzNDTDTBT solar cells.
6. 4.63%: Property Value - Power Conversion Efficiency for PzNDTDTBO solar cells.
7. FF: Property Value - Fill Factor.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.

1. 1%: Value - Percentage of 1,8-diiodooctane (DIO) added.
2. 3.22%: Value - Power Conversion Efficiency for PzNDTDTBT solar cells.
3. 4.63%: Value - Power Conversion Efficiency for PzNDTDTBO solar cells.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Value |
| --- |
| 1% - Percentage of 1,8-diiodooctane (DIO) added |
| 3.22% - Power Conversion Efficiency for PzNDTDTBT solar cells |
| 4.63% - Power Conversion Efficiency for PzNDTDTBO solar cells |
